<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:24PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:5PT">
	(1)
</SUP>
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Number is not meaningful.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Revenue:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Television advertising revenues:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;On a constant currency basis, television advertising revenues increased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, while television advertising spending in our markets is estimated to have increased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	. On a constant currency basis, television advertising revenues increased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, in line with the increase in television advertising spending for the same period.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Carriage fees and subscriptions:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;Carriage fees and subscription revenues increased during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, primarily due to the inclusion of high definition versions of certain of our channels in our offering and the launch of additional channels in the Czech Republic. Carriage fees revenues also increased across a number of other segments due to higher cable, satellite and IPTV subscriber counts. On a constant currency basis, carriage fees and subscription revenues increased in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, primarily due to higher subscriber numbers reported by the carriers, the full year benefit from certain contracts that took effect during the first quarter of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in Romania and the new carriage fee contracts in the Czech and Slovak Republics.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Other revenues:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;Other revenues, which includes primarily internet advertising, licensing and other services revenues, decreased during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;and in 2015 compared to 2014 primarily due to lower license and sublicense revenues.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	See "Segment Performance" above for additional information on trends in revenues.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Operating Expenses:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Content costs:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;Content costs (including production costs and amortization of programming rights)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;due to including an increased volume of fiction and local programming in our broadcast schedules as well as our broadcasting of UEFA European Championship matches in Romania. Content costs decreased during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;due to cost savings realized through better utilization of the program library and negotiation with suppliers, which was partly offset by an increase of programming costs in several of our countries, where heightened competition has required the use of more premium programming to maintain our audience share.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Other operating costs:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;Other operating costs during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;were broadly in line with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;as cost savings from lower transmission costs were offset by higher authors&#8217; rights association charges. Other operating costs for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;primarily due to lower transmission costs in Bulgaria, as two of our channels ceased terrestrial broadcasting in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, as well as full year savings of our restructuring efforts.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Depreciation of property, plant and equipment:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;On a constant currency basis, depreciation of property, plant and equipment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;and in 2015 compared to 2014 due to higher capital expenditures, which we had decreased significantly in prior years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Amortization of intangibles:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;Amortization of intangibles
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	. The decrease is due to higher amortization expense in 2015 for certain of our trademarks in Romania that we determined were no longer indefinite-lived and began amortizing from January&#160;1,&#160;2015 which were subsequently divested with the sale of our Romanian studios in the fourth quarter of 2015. The lower amortization expense also reflects certain intangible assets in Bulgaria which were fully amortized in the fourth quarter of 2015. On a constant currency basis, amortization of intangibles increased in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, primarily due to the amortization expense for certain of our Romanian trademarks noted above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Selling, general and administrative expenses:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Selling, general and administrative expenses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;primarily due to the reversal in the third quarter of 2015 of a charge related to certain tax audits in Romania. Excluding the impact of the reversal of this charge, selling, general and administrative expenses decreased due to lower professional fees and the reversal of a tax provision in 2016 in Croatia. These decreases were offset by increased bad debt in Bulgaria as we ceased cooperation with one agency during the fourth quarter of 2016 and instead started working directly with the clients that agency represented. Selling, general and administrative expenses decreased in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, primarily due to the reversal of a charge related to the tax audits of Romania mentioned above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	28
</FONT>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;" HREF="#CETV-1231201610K_HTM_S00B32073D8D25F1EA1C1BC286D6EFE32">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Index
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Selling, general and administrative expenses in 2016 include a charge of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	3.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in respect of non-cash stock-based compensation, an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	increase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	1.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;(see Item 8,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 16, "Stock-based Compensation"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	). Non-cash stock-based compensation charges were US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	1.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Restructuring costs:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;There were no restructuring charges in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	. The decrease in restructuring charges in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to 2014 was primarily due to the elimination of fewer positions in our 2015 plan as compared to the 2014 plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Operating income:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;On a constant currency basis, operating income increased from 2014 through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;largely due to increased television advertising and carriage fee revenues while maintaining effective cost control efforts. Excluding the effect of the charge related to the Romanian tax audits, operating income in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;was US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	82.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Our operating margin, which is determined as operating income / loss divided by net revenues, was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	17.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	15.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	5.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	. Excluding the effects of the charge and the release of the reserves related to the Romanian tax audits, operating margin in 2015 and 2014 was 13.6% and 7.4%, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Other income / expense items for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2014
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	(44.4
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

	)%

<TD>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:5PT">
	(1)
</SUP>
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Number is not meaningful.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Interest expense:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;Interest expense decreased in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, primarily due to lower amortization of debt discount and issuance costs following the extinguishment of the 2017 PIK Notes and 2017 Term Loan and due to a lower cost of borrowing following the refinancing of such indebtedness (each bearing interest of 15% per annum) with the 2021 Euro Term Loan (with an all-in rate of 9.0% per annum as at December 31, 2016). Interest expense increased in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, primarily due to the full year interest expense and amortization of debt issuance costs and original issuance discount related to refinancing transactions conducted in 2015(see Item 8,&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 14, "Interest Expense"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Loss on extinguishment of debt:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, we recognized a loss on extinguishment of debt related to the redemption and discharge of the 2017 PIK Notes, repayment of the 2017 Term Loan and modifications of the 2018 Euro Term Loan and the 2019 Euro Term Loan, which were accounted for in a similar manner as a debt extinguishment. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, we recognized losses on the redemption of the remaining outstanding portion of our 2016 Fixed Rate Notes and the redemption of the 2017 Fixed Rate Notes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Interest income:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;Our interest income is generated solely by interest accrued on our cash deposits.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Foreign currency exchange gain / (loss), net:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;We are exposed to fluctuations in foreign exchange rates on the revaluation of monetary assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other than the local functional currency of the relevant subsidiary. This includes third party receivables and payables, including certain of our intercompany loans which are not considered of a long-term investment nature. Our subsidiaries generally receive funding via loans that are denominated in currencies other than the dollar, and any change in the relevant exchange rate will require us to recognize a transaction gain or loss on revaluation. Certain of our intercompany loans are classified as long-term in nature, and therefore gains or losses on revaluation are not recorded through the statement of operations and comprehensive income / loss. See the discussion under "Currency translation adjustment, net" below.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, we recognized a net gain of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	6.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, comprised of transaction gains of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	38.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;relating to the revaluation of intercompany loans, transaction losses of approximately US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	28.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;on our long-term debt and other financing arrangements and transaction losses of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	3.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;relating to the revaluation of monetary assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other than the local functional currency of the relevant subsidiary.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, we recognized a net loss of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	13.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, comprised of transaction losses of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	29.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;relating to the revaluation of intercompany loans, transaction gains of approximately US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	31.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;on our long-term debt and other financing arrangements and transaction losses of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	15.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;relating to the revaluation of monetary assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other than the local functional currency of the relevant subsidiary.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, we recognized a net loss of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	12.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, comprised of transaction gains of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	1.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;relating to the revaluation of intercompany loans, transaction gains of approximately US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	4.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;on our long-term debt and other financing arrangements and transaction losses of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	18.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;relating to the revaluation of monetary assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other than the local functional currency of the relevant subsidiary.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">

<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;" HREF="#CETV-1231201610K_HTM_S00B32073D8D25F1EA1C1BC286D6EFE32">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Index
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Change in fair value of derivatives:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;During
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, we recognized a net loss primarily due to a loss on USD/EUR foreign currency forward contracts entered into in connection with the refinancing of the 2017 PIK Notes and 2017 Term Loan. During
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, we recognized a net gain primarily as a result of a gain on a foreign currency forward contract entered into in connection with the refinancing of the 2015 Convertible Notes at maturity, which was partly offset by losses on certain other foreign currency forward contracts relating to certain dollar-denominated programming payments made in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	. During
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, we recognized a net gain as a result of a gain on a foreign currency forward contract entered into in connection with the refinancing of the 2016 Fixed Rate Notes. See Item 8,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 13, "Financial Instruments and Fair Value Measurements"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Other income / (expense), net:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;Other income / expense, net was not material in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;or 2014. Other expense in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;was primarily due to the loss on sale of the parent company of our former Romanian studio operation, which did not meet the definition of a discontinued operation, and on the loss on sale of an excess facility in Bulgaria.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Provision) / credit for income taxes:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;The provision for income taxes during 2016 reflects tax charges on profits in the Czech Republic and Romania offset by the release of the valuation allowances in Bulgaria and the Slovak Republic.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The credit for income taxes during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;reflects the release of a valuation allowance in Romania offset by deferred tax charges on profits in the Czech Republic and Croatia.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The credit for income taxes during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;reflects the value of the deferred tax benefit that we have realized on the operating loss incurred by our Czech Republic segment, which was substantially lower in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Our operating subsidiaries are subject to income taxes at statutory rates ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	10.0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in Bulgaria to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	22.0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in Slovakia (see Item 8,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 17, "Income Taxes"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	). From January 1, 2017, the statutory income tax rate in the Slovak Republic is 21%.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Net loss attributable to noncontrolling interests:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;The net losses attributable to noncontrolling interests relate to the noncontrolling interest share of the comprehensive losses in our Bulgaria operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Currency translation adjustment, net:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;The underlying equity value of our investments (which are denominated in the functional currency of the relevant entity) are converted into dollars at each balance sheet date, with any change in value of the underlying assets and liabilities being recorded as a currency translation adjustment to the balance sheet rather than net income / loss.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, we recognized other comprehensive income of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	1.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;compared to other comprehensive losses of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	89.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;and US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	156.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	. Included in these amounts are foreign exchange gains and losses on the retranslation of certain of our intercompany loans which are considered to be of a long-term investment nature, and as such, are included in accumulated other comprehensive income / loss, a component of shareholders' equity. For the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, we recognized a gain of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	8.8&#160;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;and losses of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	89.0&#160;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;and US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	164.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, respectively, in accumulated other comprehensive income / loss. In addition, management determined that CME Ltd.'s functional currency is the Euro with effect from April 1, 2016. As a result of this change, we recognized a charge of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	4.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;of currency translation adjustment in the second quarter of 2016 due to the translation of non-monetary assets into Euro as of the date of the change.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

	Index
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>

</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Percent Change During the Year Ended

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	December&#160;31, 2015

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Percent Change During the Year Ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/09/0000925645-17-000003_FX2014.JPG" ALT="FX2014.JPG" STYLE="HEIGHT:400PX;WIDTH:682PX;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Unrealized loss on derivative instruments:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;The unrealized loss on derivatives is due to the effective portion of changes in the fair value of our interest rate swaps classified as cash flow hedges and recognized in accumulated other comprehensive income / loss.
</FONT>
</DIV>

</TD>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

	Number is not meaningful.
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note: The analysis below is intended to highlight the key factors that led to the movements from December 31,&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, excluding the impact of foreign currency translation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Current assets:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;Current assets at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;decreased compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;due to lower cash, which was primarily used to pay Guarantee Fees in respect of the 2018 Euro Term Loan (including Guarantee Fees previously paid in kind) and lower deferred tax assets which were reclassified to non-current upon the prospective adoption of new accounting guidance. These decreases were partly offset by higher accounts receivable as a result of increased revenue.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Non-current assets:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;Excluding the effects of foreign currency translation, non-current assets at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;increased slightly compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, primarily due to an increase in the amount of local productions ahead of the spring schedule as well as capital expenditures made during 2016. The increases are partly offset by amortization expense related to debt issuance costs and our finite-lived intangible assets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Current liabilities:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;Current liabilities at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;increased compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, primarily as a result of higher accrued interest (including Guarantee Fees) payable, programming payables and income taxes payable.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Non-current liabilities:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;Non-current liabilities at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;increased compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, primarily due to the refinancing of the 2017&#160;PIK&#160;Notes and the 2017 Term Loan, both of which had significant issuance discounts, with the 2021 Euro Term Loan, which had no such discount (see Item&#160;8,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 4, "Long-term Debt and Other Financing Arrangements"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Temporary equity:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;Temporary equity at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;represents the accreted value of the Series B Preferred Shares issued to TW Investor on June 25, 2013.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CME Ltd. shareholders&#8217; (deficit) / equity:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;CME Ltd. shareholders&#8217; equity decreased to a deficit in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, primarily due to the net loss attributable to CME Ltd., accretion of the preferred dividend paid in kind on our Series B Preferred Shares and unrealized losses on derivative instruments designated as interest rate hedges of the Euro Term Loans. These decreases were partly offset by exercises of common stock warrants and stock-based compensation charges.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Noncontrolling interests in consolidated subsidiaries:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;The noncontrolling interests in consolidated subsidiaries represents the noncontrolling interest share of our Bulgaria operations.
</FONT>

</EFX_CASH_FLOW>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Operating Activities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Cash generated from continuing operations during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;decreased as compared to 2015 as higher revenue and OIBDA were offset by higher cash payments for interest and for Guarantee Fees, including Guarantee Fees previously paid in kind. Cash generated from continuing operations during 2015 increased compared to 2014 due to better OIBDA performance and lower interest payments paid in cash. Additionally, the level of payments for programming was more normalized in 2015 than in prior years, which also contributed to the improvement in free cash flow.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	We paid cash interest (including in respect of Guarantee Fees) of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	91.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, US$ 18.5 million and US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	76.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;on our long-term debt and credit facilities in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investing Activities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Net cash used in continuing investing activities consists primarily of capital expenditures for property, plant and equipment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Financing Activities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The net cash used in continuing financing activities in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;primarily reflected the refinancing of the 2017 PIK Notes and the 2017 Term Loan with the proceeds of the 2021 Euro Term Loan and cash on hand, including payments for transaction fees and to settle a foreign currency forward contract we entered into in connection with the refinancing. We received proceeds of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	7.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;from the exercise of common stock warrants.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The net cash used in continuing financing activities in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;primarily reflected the repayment of the amounts outstanding under the 2021 Revolving Credit Facility and the refinancing of the 2015 Convertible Notes with the 2019 Euro Term Loan. We also received net proceeds of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	8.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;from a foreign currency forward contract we entered into in connection with the refinancing of the 2015 Convertible Notes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The net cash provided by continuing financing activities during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;primarily reflected the proceeds of the rights offering conducted in 2014 and related financing transactions and a drawdown on the 2021 Revolving Credit Facility, partially offset by the payment made to redeem and discharge the 2016 Fixed Rate Notes and the 2017 Fixed Rate Notes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Discontinued Operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The net cash provided by discontinued operations during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;and 2015 primarily reflected proceeds from the divestiture of businesses, including deferred proceeds. The net cash used in discontinued operations in 2014 primarily reflected the net cash used in our businesses classified as discontinued operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="CETV-1231201610K_HTM_S8B0BEB36C8FFA4BF0738BC2871D67884">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	III(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Sources and Uses of Cash
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Our ongoing source of cash is primarily the receipt of payments from advertisers, advertising agencies and distributors of our television channels. We also have available the 2021 Revolving Credit Facility (see Item 8,&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 4, "Long-term Debt and Other Financing Arrangements"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	). As at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, the undrawn aggregate principal amount available under the 2021 Revolving Credit Facility was US$ 115.0 million, which will be reduced to US$ 50.0 million from January&#160;1,&#160;2018. Surplus cash, after funding ongoing operations, may be remitted to us, where appropriate, by our subsidiaries in the form of debt interest payments and capital repayments, dividends, and other distributions and loans from our subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Corporate law in the Central and Eastern European countries in which we operate stipulates generally that dividends may be declared by shareholders out of yearly profits subject to the maintenance of registered capital, required reserves (if applicable) and after the recovery of accumulated losses. The reserve requirement restriction generally provides that before dividends may be distributed, a portion of annual net profits (typically at least
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	) be allocated to a reserve, which reserve is capped at a proportion of the registered capital of a company (ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	). There are no third-party restrictions that limit our subsidiaries' ability to transfer amounts to us in the form of loans or advances.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	33
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Long-Term Debt
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	For more information on our long-term debt, see Item 8,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 4, "Long-term Debt and Other Financing Arrangements"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	. Interest payable on our long-term debt is calculated using interest rates and exchange rates as at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	. For the purposes of the above table, it is assumed that the Guarantee Fees will be paid in kind at each interest payment date until the maturity dates of the related Euro Term Loan and such amounts are included under "Long-term debt - interest.".
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Unconditional Purchase Obligations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Unconditional purchase obligations primarily comprise future programming commitments.&#160;At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, we had commitments in respect of future programming of US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	128.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	. This includes contracts signed with license periods starting after
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Operating Leases
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	For more information on our operating lease commitments see Item 8,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 20, "Commitments and Contingencies"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Other Long-Term Obligations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Other long-term obligations are primarily comprised of digital transmission commitments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Other
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Top Tone Media Holdings Limited has exercised its right to acquire additional equity in CME Bulgaria. However, the closing of this transaction has not yet occurred because purchaser financing is still pending. If consummated, we would own&#160;90.0%&#160;of our Bulgaria broadcast operations. The option strike price is the fair value of the equity in CME Bulgaria, as determined by an independent valuation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="CETV-1231201610K_HTM_S8B176B6E7D8F173357BCBC2872289FCD">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	III(d)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Cash Outlook
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Because cash flows from operating activities were negative in 2012, 2013 and 2014, we relied on equity and debt financings to ensure adequate funding for our operations. While cash flows from operating activities were positive in 2015 and 2016, our election to pay interest on the 2017 PIK Notes and the 2017 Term Loan (prior to their repayment) and Guarantee Fees in kind increased our gross leverage. In response, we have sought other capital resources to fund our operations, our debt service and other obligations, including the refinancing transaction below.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	On April&#160;7,&#160;2016, we drew on the EUR
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	468.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;(approximately US$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	534.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;as at the transaction date) 2021 Euro Term Loan, the proceeds of which, together with cash on hand, were applied toward the repayment of the 2017 Term Loan plus accrued interest and the redemption and discharge of the 2017 PIK Notes plus accrued interest thereon. We also extended the maturity date of the 2018 Euro Term Loan by one year to November 1, 2018. In addition, we amended the interest rate applicable to amounts drawn on the 2021 Revolving Credit Facility such that interest is determined on the basis of our net leverage ratio (as defined in the Reimbursement Agreement) and ranges from LIBOR (subject to a floor of 1.0%) plus 9.0% if our net leverage ratio is greater than or equal to seven times, to LIBOR (subject to a floor of 1.0%) plus 6.0% per annum if our net leverage ratio is less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;times; and extended the maturity date of the 2021 Revolving Credit Facility to February 19, 2021, with a reduction in the borrowing capacity from US$ 115.0 million to US$&#160;50.0 million&#160;from January&#160;1,&#160;2018. Following these transactions, our nearest debt maturity is November&#160;1,&#160;2018 and our cost of borrowing has decreased.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	We are continuing to take actions to improve cash flow including maintaining strict cost discipline and improving working capital management, with the intention of using cash generated by the business, together with expected proceeds from warrant exercises and savings from lower debt service obligations, to substantially repay our nearest debt maturity in November 2018. We intend to commence repayment of such maturity beginning November 2017. In this respect, in 2016 we paid US$ 37.4 million of Guarantee Fees related to the 2018 Euro Term Loan, including amounts previously paid in kind, and we expect to pay all Guarantee Fees related to the 2018 Euro Term Loan in cash as they come due. We anticipate paying Guarantee Fees related to the 2019 Euro Term Loan and the 2021 Euro Term Loan, in kind where we have the option. We are also continuing to evaluate possibilities to further deleverage the business.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	In addition, we expect the amounts of cash paid for income taxes to increase and begin converging with local statutory tax rates as our operating companies in each jurisdiction return to generating profits and previous net operating losses are utilized.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	34
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;" HREF="#CETV-1231201610K_HTM_S00B32073D8D25F1EA1C1BC286D6EFE32">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Index
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Credit ratings and future debt issuances
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Our corporate credit is rated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	B2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;by Moody's Investors Service and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	B+
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;by Standard &amp; Poor's, both with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	stable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;outlook. Our ratings show each agency's opinion of our financial strength, operating performance and ability to meet our debt obligations as they become due. These ratings take into account the particular emphasis the ratings agencies place on metrics such as leverage ratio and cash flow, which they use as measurements of a company's liquidity and financial strength.&#160;&#160;They also reflect an emphasis by the ratings agencies on the track record of strong financial support from Time Warner. We may be subject to downgrades if our operating performance deteriorates or we fail to maintain adequate levels of liquidity. In addition, our ratings may be downgraded if the agencies form a&#160;view that material support from Time Warner is not as strong, or the strategic importance of CME to Time Warner is not as significant as it has been in the past.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Credit risk of financial counterparties
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	We have entered into a number of significant contracts with financial counterparties as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Interest Rate Swap
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	We are party to interest rate swap agreements to mitigate our exposure to interest rate fluctuations on our Euro Term Loans. These interest rate swaps, designated as cash flow hedges, provide the Company with variable-rate cash receipts in exchange for fixed-rate payments over the lives of the agreements, with no exchange of the underlying notional amount.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Foreign Exchange Forwards
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	We are exposed to movements in the USD to EUR exchange rates related to contractual payments under dollar-denominated agreements. To reduce this exposure, from time to time we enter into pay-Euro receive-dollar forward foreign exchange contracts. We had no such agreements outstanding at December 31, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Cash Deposits
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	We deposit cash in the global money markets with a range of bank counterparties and review the counterparties we choose weekly. The maximum period of deposit is three months but we have more recently held amounts on deposit for shorter periods, from overnight to one month. The credit rating of a bank is a critical factor in determining the size of cash deposits and we will only deposit cash with banks of investment grade. In addition we also closely monitor the credit default swap spreads and other market information for each of the banks with which we consider depositing or have deposited funds.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="CETV-1231201610K_HTM_SBD96ADA4A54898C2369ABC28724F0BAF">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	III(e)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	None.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="CETV-1231201610K_HTM_S35A8037133AC74C3F902BC2872727232">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	IV.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Our accounting policies affecting our financial condition and results of operations are more fully described in Item 8,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Note 2, "Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	. The preparation of these financial statements requires us to make judgments in selecting appropriate assumptions for calculating financial estimates, which inherently contain some degree of uncertainty. We base our estimates on historical experience and on various other assumptions that we believe to be reasonable. Using these estimates we make judgments about the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses that are not readily apparent from other sources. Actual results may differ from these estimates under different assumptions or conditions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	We believe the following critical accounting policies affect our more significant judgments and estimates used in the preparation of our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Program Rights
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Program rights consist of programming (film and television) acquired from third parties and produced locally, which together form an important component of our station broadcasting schedules. Acquired program rights and the related liabilities are recorded at their gross value when the license period begins and the programs are available for use. Where the initial airing of content allowed by a license is expected to provide more value than subsequent airings, program rights are amortized over their expected useful lives in a manner which reflects the pattern we expect to use and benefit from the programming. These films and series are amortized with the amortization charged in respect of each airing calculated in accordance with a schedule that reflects our estimate of the relative economic value of each run. We review our programming amortization policy when events occur or circumstances change that would so require.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The program library is evaluated at least quarterly to determine if expected revenues are sufficient to cover the unamortized portion of each program. To the extent that the revenues we expect to earn from broadcasting a program are lower than the book value, the program rights are written down to their net realizable value by recording an impairment charge. Accordingly, our estimates of future advertising and other revenues, and our future broadcasting schedules have a significant impact on the value of our program rights on the consolidated balance sheet and the annual programming amortization charge recorded in the consolidated statement of operations and comprehensive income / loss.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Produced Program Rights
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	We also produce and license a variety of filmed content. The majority of this is television movies and series which are predominantly expected to be utilized by transmission on our broadcast stations. Produced program rights, which include direct costs, production overhead and development costs, are stated at the lower of cost, net of accumulated amortization, or net realizable value.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	When we recognize revenue on a title, we also recognize a proportion of the capitalized film costs in the respective statements of operations using the individual film forecast model. The proportion of costs recognized is equal to the proportion of the revenue recognized compared to the total revenue expected to be generated throughout the title's life cycle (the "ultimate revenues").
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	35
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;" HREF="#CETV-1231201610K_HTM_S00B32073D8D25F1EA1C1BC286D6EFE32">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Index
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The process of evaluating a title's ultimate revenues requires management judgment and is inherently subjective. The calculation of ultimate revenue can be a complex one, however, the level of complexity and subjectivity is correlated to the number of revenue streams that management believes will be earned. Our process for evaluating ultimate revenues is tailored to the potential we believe a title has for generating multiple types of revenues. As already mentioned, the majority of our production is intended primarily for exploitation by our own broadcasters and we have few supportable expectations of generating revenue from other sources. In such cases, we consider mainly the free television window in our calculation of the ultimate revenue. Changes in estimates of ultimate revenues from period to period affect the amount of film costs amortized in a given period and, therefore, could have an impact on our results for that period.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	When the estimated ultimate revenues, less additional costs to be incurred (including exploitation costs), are less than the carrying amount of the film costs, the value of a film is deemed to be not recoverable and thus, an immediate write-off of unrecoverable film costs is recorded in the consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive income / loss.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Impairment of goodwill, indefinite-lived intangible assets and long-lived assets
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	We assess the carrying amount of goodwill and other intangible assets with indefinite lives on an annual basis, or more frequently if events or changes in circumstances indicate that such carrying amount may not be recoverable. Other than our annual review, factors we consider important which could trigger an impairment review include: under-performance of reporting units or changes in projected results, changes in the manner of utilization of the asset, a severe and sustained decline in the price of our shares and negative market conditions or economic trends. Therefore, our judgment as to the future prospects of each business has a significant impact on our results and financial condition. We believe that our assumptions are appropriate. If future cash flows do not materialize as expected or there is a future adverse change in market conditions, we may be unable to recover the carrying amount of an asset, resulting in future impairment losses.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Impairment tests of our goodwill are performed at the reporting unit level. If potential impairments of goodwill exist, the fair value of the reporting unit is subsequently measured against the fair value of its underlying assets and liabilities, excluding goodwill, to estimate an implied fair value of the reporting unit's goodwill. An impairment loss is recognized for any excess of the carrying amount of the reporting unit's goodwill over the implied fair value. If goodwill and another asset or asset group are tested for impairment at the same time, the other assets are tested for impairment before goodwill. If the other asset or asset group is impaired, this impairment loss is recognized prior to goodwill being tested for impairment. Impairment tests of other intangible assets with indefinite lives are performed at the asset level. An impairment loss is recognized for any excess of the carrying amount of the intangible asset over the fair value.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The fair value of each reporting unit, and consequently the implied fair value of the reporting unit's goodwill, is determined using an income methodology estimating projected future cash flows related to each reporting unit. These projected future cash flows are discounted back to the valuation date. Significant assumptions inherent in the methodology used include estimates of discount rates, future revenue growth rates and a number of other factors, all of which are based on our assessment of the future prospects and the risks inherent at the respective reporting units. We have identified six reporting units which consist of our six geographic operating segments: Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Romania, Slovak Republic and Slovenia.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Recoverability of assets to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of an asset to estimated undiscounted future cash flows expected to be generated by the respective asset. The same estimates are also used in planning for our long- and short-range business planning and forecasting. We assess the reasonableness of the inputs and outcomes of our undiscounted cash flow analysis against available comparable market data. If the carrying amount of an asset exceeds its estimated undiscounted future cash flows, an impairment charge is recognized for the amount by which the carrying amount exceeds the fair value of the respective asset.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The table below shows the key measurements involved and the valuation methods applied:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_26"></A>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:99.80506822612085%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

	Measurement
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

	Recoverability of carrying amounts

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
